title: South Live: Wednesday 15 November - BBC News
summary: search for missing gaia pope continues .
trial of three accused of killing guy hedger begins .
two held after fatal crash released .

documents.title: missing gaia still alive , says family
text: missing gaia still alive , says family

documents.title: that 's all for today !
text: the bbc south live service will resume at 08:00 on thursday when we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and weather from across the region .
you can get in touch with your and news anytime on our berkshire , hampshire , dorset and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: brian tumour patient gives back to charity
text: tom peddie found out he had a brain tumour when he was four .
now he 's an ambassador for the charity which helped him .
the brain tumour charity , in farnborough , hampshire , has been chosen to receive a donation from bbc children in need .

documents.title: the 83-year-old fitness instructor
text: an 83-year-old fitness instructor from berkshire is still teaching techniques that were invented by her mother over 60 years ago .
esther fairfax , from hungerford , is the daughter of lotte berk , who fled nazi germany and created a new exercise routine that became popular with celebrities after the war .
lotte 's story has now attracted the attention of hollywood film producers .

documents.title: breakinggaia pope : new cctv images released
text: police have released cctv images of missing dorset teenager gaia pope that were taken less than an hour before she disappeared on 7 november .
ms pope , 19 , was filmed in a garage in swanage wearing a black jacket , which was later recovered at an address in manor gardens .
police said their search efforts today were focused inland in swanage and the surrounding area .
officers said searches at two swanage properties , which started on monday , were likely to continue for some time .

documents.title: shooting trial hears husband 's 999 call
text: an emotional 999 call made by the husband of a businessman shot in his home has been played at the trial of three men accused of his murder .
guy hedger , 61 , was killed at about 03:00 bst on 30 april after intruders entered his home in ashley , near ringwood .
on the recording , simon hedger cooper is heard telling an emergency operator `` my husband 's been shot '' .
jason baccus , scott keeping and kevin downton all deny murder .
the court heard mr hedger cooper said he pressed a panic alarm after being asked to open two safes .
in his statement to police he said alarms started to go off and straight away he heard a `` big boom '' before hearing his husband say : `` i 've been shot . ''
the trial at winchester crown court continues .

documents.title: 'dangerous ' wareham railway crossing ramps consultation under way
text: plans to upgrade a rail footbridge to replace a level crossing once branded one of the most dangerous in the country have opened to public consultation .
dorset county council 's proposals for the existing wareham station footbridge involve creating new step-free ramps up to the bridge at either side .
the level crossing is due to be shut over safety concerns , and as part of a national programme of closures .
the consultation runs until 8 december .

documents.title: tribute to truck driver killed in bridport crash
text: a man who died in a crash involving a truck and a car in dorset was a `` big personality '' , his family has said .
steve spear , 64 , from bridport , was driving a black mitsubishi l200 truck which collided with a silver mercedes convertible on the a35 sea road south on monday .
he died at the scene .
three men , aged 30 , 32 and 35 , from the mercedes suffered serious injuries .
an arrested 33-year-old man and 27-year-old woman have been released without charge .
they were arrested on sus of driving offences along with a 30-year-old local man who `` is still assisting officers with their enquiries '' , dorset police said .
steve was a well known and loved member of the bridport community .
he was a loving husband , father , stepfather , grandfather , brother and friend to many .
a big personality who will be hugely missed by many people in the town and beyond .

documents.title: missing gaia pope : cousin appeals for help with search
text: the cousin of gaia pope has said her family `` absolutely believes '' the missing teenager is still alive .
marienna pope-weidemann was speaking as the search continues around swanage , more than a week after 19-year-old gaia was last seen .
ms pope-weidemann appealed for people to keep on looking for gaia .
a 71-year-old woman and a 19-year-old man from swanage , arrested on sus of murder on monday have been released while inquiries continue .
author: Steve Humphrey
BBC South Today

documents.title: up to 75 university jobs at risk
text: up to 75 university jobs at risk

documents.title: in solent oyster stocks double
text: following yesterday 's news that stocks of native oysters reintroduced to the solent in a bid to revive fishing in the areahave doubled , here are some of the work blue marine foundation has been carrying out .

documents.title: businessman 'shot dead by masked men '
text: businessman 'shot dead by masked men '

documents.title: attacker 'claimed she was police officer '
text: a woman who punched a dog walker several times in the head said she was a police officer and told him he was under arrest , police have said .
a man in his 20s was attacked in twyford when a female dog walker , who identified herself as an officer , barged past him .
she later approached him and told him he was under arrest before punching him several times in the head .
police said it was `` not clear '' whether the woman was an actual officer .

documents.title: fatal crash suspects released
text: two people who were arrested following a fatal crash in bridport have been released without charge .
a truck driver died at the scene of the collision on the a35 sea road south at 23:15 gmt on monday .
three men in a mercedes car were taken to hospital with serious injuries .
a fourth man and a woman aged 27 were detained on sus of driving offences but have now been released with no further action .
a 30-year-old man is still helping with inquiries , police said .

documents.title: 'we know she 's alive '
text: a cousin of missing teenager gaia pope has said her family is convinced she is still alive .
marienna pope-weidemann urged people to continue searching for the 19-year-old , who was reportedly last seen in swanage on 7 november .
everyone is giving 150 % .
all i can say is please , please , please do n't stop looking .
we know she is out there , we know she 's alive .
we 're going to bring our girl home .

documents.title: taking a walk down a crossrail tunnel
text: taking a walk down a crossrail tunnel

documents.title: winchester ice rink plan unveiled after 30-year bid
text: a £ 20m olym ice arena , with four-lane curling rink , is planned for winchester .
the proposed development at the old depot site at bar end would also include a 120-bed hotel and restaurant .
the plans follow a 30-year campaign by winchester ice sport association to get a rink back on the south coast after the one in southampton closed in 1988 .
developers aethos development limited will present the proposals to city councillors at a meeting later .

documents.title: noise control orders served over train depot
text: two rail firms have been served with noise abatement notices over `` serious noise issues '' at reading train care depot .
reading borough council said it had spent `` many hours '' at properties in cardiff road monitoring noise from diesel trains , which it said had `` blighted the lives '' of residents .
it said it had to serve the legal notices following `` years of inactivity from both fgw [ first great western ] and network rail on this important issue '' .
the two firms and their directors could now be prosecuted if the noise continues beyond a specified six month period .

documents.title: restaurant badly damaged in fire
text: a restaurant kitchen has been destroyed in a fire , which closed the a40 in oxfordshire overnight .
fire crews were called at 00:20 gmt to the swan at tetsworth , near thame , after a neighbour heard a smoke alarm .
they prevented the fire from spreading to the adjoining antiques centre , which remains open .
the cause is being investigated .
owner tom keane said : `` we 're very , very lucky .
it could have gone so much worse . ''

documents.title: breakingguy hedger murder trial under way
text: three men have gone on trial accused of murdering a businessman who was shot at his home in dorset .
guy hedger , 61 , died in the early hours of 30 april after intruders broke into his home in ashley , near ringwood , and opened fire with a shotgun .
a jury heard how mr hedger and his husband , simon-pierre hedger cooper , were confronted by two masked men with a sawn-off shotgun in their bedroom at around 03:00 .

jason baccus , 42 , and scott keeping , 44 , both of verney close , bournemouth , and kevin downton , 40 , of winterborne stickland , near blandford , deny murder and other charges including possession of a firearm and burglary .
scott keeping 's wife - helen keeping , 40 , from poole - is accused of two counts of assisting an offender .
the trial at winchester crown court is expected to last six weeks .

documents.title: up to 75 university jobs at risk
text: up to 75 academics are set to lose their jobs under a university 's restructuring plans .
the university of southampton wants to reduce its number of faculties from eight to five by august 2018 .
it said between 50 and 75 posts will be lost in six subject areas , under plans to `` strengthen its national and international rankings '' .
the university and college union ( ucu ) said the `` rushed and dangerous '' proposals could undermine the quality of teaching .

documents.title: searches continue for missing gaia
text: searches for missing teenager gaia pope are continuing in swanage and the surrounding area today , dorset police has said .
on tuesday , rosemary dinch , 71 , and her 19-year-old grandson , nathan elsey , who had been arrested on sus of murdering ms pope , were released pending further inquiries .
det supt paul kessler said : `` we still believe gaia is somewhere in the swanage area i remain hopeful that we will find gaia alive . ''
the 19-year-old , from langton matravers , disappeared from swanage , where she had been staying , on 7 november .

documents.title: hampshire care homes rated 'inadequate ' by inspectors
text: two residential care homes in hampshire have been placed into `` special measures '' following care quality commission ( cqc ) inspections .

the unannounced inspections at southampton city council-run shearwater in milton , portsmouth , and gosport 's northcott house residential care and nursing home , which is managed by contemplation homes limited , took place in september .
`` serious concerns '' were found at northcott house regarding the safety of the service .
the report said there was a `` lack of leadership '' among staff and residents were `` at risk of harm because appropriate measures had not been implemented to identify and assess risks '' .
according to the report for shearwater there was a lack of clear guidance for the safe use and administration of some medicines and patient records were not always accurate or complete .
inspectors also found there were not enough regular staff .
however , it was found to be a caring service .

documents.title: emergency prefab homes unveiled
text: new units to accommodate homeless families in reading have arrived at caversham park and are being installed .
the 28 modular homes in lowfield road are for people who would otherwise have to stay in bed and breakfast accommodation .
each prefabricated home has two bedrooms , a bathroom , a kitchen-diner and a living room , reading borough council said .
the first families are expected to move in in january .
modular homes which will provide temporary accommodation for homeless families have been delivered in caversham park : # rdguk
great news !
wonderful !
so good to see this !

documents.title: closure of city respite centre agreed
text: closure of city respite centre agreed

documents.title: closure of southampton respite centre agreed
text: councillors have approved the closure of a respite centre in southampton .
the centre in kentish road will shut on 30 november , as part of £ 120m cuts , following a vote by the city council 's cabinet .
service users and their families had urged councillors to save the centre and are now planning to launch legal action against the decision .
a report said alternative arrangements had been identified for the 30 people who use the facility .

documents.title: travel : chain ferry shut for maintenance
text: the sandbanks ferry , between poole and studland , is closed for maintenance work .
the service is expected to resume at 16:40 gmt , with the first crossing from the poole side .
no @ twitterid service between 9am and 4.40pm today for maintenance .

documents.title: train fire halts island line service
text: trains on the isle of wight were cancelled last night after a fire broke out on a train near ryde .
the fire on the island line train which operates between ryde pier head and shanklin started just before 19:30 gmt .
it broke out on a piece of equipment that connects the engine to the electric third rail .
island line said train staff and fire crews dealt with the fire and nobody was hurt .

documents.title: closure threat for town 's health centre
text: closure threat for town 's health centre

documents.title: closure threat for town 's health centre
text: a health centre with about 6,000 patients in banbury is threatened with closure in a reorganisation of gp services .
those registered at banbury health centre would move to a larger practice with 30,000 patients created by merging woodlands surgery and west bar surgery .
it is a `` preferred option '' put forward by oxfordshire clinical commissioning group ( occg ) .
it is due to consult the public on the plans in january .

documents.title: man charged with policeman 's crash death
text: man charged with policeman 's crash death

documents.title: man faces charge over policeman death
text: a man is to be prosecuted over the death of a policeman who was hit by a car as he tried to stop it getting away .
pc gareth browning was on foot in whitley , reading , on 30 november 2013 when he was struck by a black mazda .
he never recovered from his injuries and died on 1 april this year at the age of 36 , police said .
the attorney general has granted the authority to prosecute luke haywood , 32 , formerly of ian mikardo way , reading , with one count of manslaughter .
he is due before reading magistrates on a date to be fixed .

documents.title: headlines : search continues for missing gaia
text: headlines : search continues for missing gaia

documents.title: weather : murky and damp , brighter later
text: alina jenkins has wednesday 's forecast for the south of england .

documents.title: buffer zone plan for portsmouth abortion clinic
text: a council is considering create a buffer zone around an abortion clinic in a bid to curb protests outside .
pro-life campaigners have been protesting alongside pro-choice counter-protesters outside portsmouth 's st mary 's hospital .
the city council voted to fully explore `` every available option to provide the necessary reassurance and security that all women need '' .
a public spaces protection order ( pspo ) is one solution being considered .
it follows moves by ealing council to introduce a pspo to halt protests outside the marie stopes clinic in the london borough .

documents.title: south western railway christmas line closures planned in hampshire
text: south western railway passengers are being warned to plan their journeys over the christmas period due to £ 8m engineering works in hampshire .
the line between southampton airport parkway and southampton central , and between fareham and southampton central will shut from 24 december to 1 january .
london , bournemouth , poole and weymouth journeys will also be affected .
network rail said the work would make journeys `` more reliable '' .
buses will replace trains in the area of the line closures , but passengers have been advised to travel before christmas eve .
services on 10 and 17 december will also be affected by the work .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to south live , where we 'll be bringing you the latest updates from across the region until 18.00 .
you can get in touch with your and news on our berkshire , hampshire , dorset and oxford facebook pages , or by using twitter @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
